headline: Spanish Brown Rice
description: Brown rice simmers with salsa, tomatoes, and garlic for a flavorful and wholesome spin on Spanish rice.
name: Spanish Brown Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Combine rice and garlic in a saucepan. Stir in water, salsa, and diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil.
Stir rice mixture and reduce heat to low. Simmer, covered, for 50 minutes. Turn off heat and allow rice to sit, covered, for an additional 5 to 10 minutes. Stir rice before serving.

review.reviewBody: I adjusted where I thought my likes would appreciate and it was a great dish. I appreciate the guide because that is all a recipe is mostly. I like mine with heat, like a mix of fresh ground chilies. I charred a few for deeper flavor and bit more garlic, (also charred a couple cloves) add black pepper and yum.

Made this to go with fajita marinated chicken breasts. Read reviews and used lots of the hints. Added mexicorn, green onions. Used fresh tomatoes for canned diced. Added a pinch each of cumin, mild chili powder and ancho chili powder. This is a fabulous recipe to work to your taste. Thanks for a brown rice recipe that is so so good.

The rice turned out perfect. I used long grain brown rice and was nervous about not following the instructions on the back which said 35m. Followed this recipe and it turned out perfect - you would never know it's brown rice. I add black beans, corn, and use pam spray to fry up onion, garlic, red and green peppers with it. Add shrimp at the end. So healthy and so delicious.

My addition was to add chopped celery and onion (sautéed in olive oil). Used extra chunky salsa. My only challenge was my rice came out too “sticky” for me. I know what I did wrong, so not blaming the recipe. Other than that, this made a tasty meal. I paired this with Honey Glazed Chicken. Came out very good. Will make excellent leftovers.

We needed something to go with a taco dinner for my husbands getaway with the guys for playing board games. I made this ahead of time for him to warm up. I doubled it and placed it in my ricemaker (i have never been able to make rice). I did not use extra tomatoes. I used chicken stock with tomato sauce for the liquid. Everything else remained the same. The rice still seemed a little chewy but since i always have problems with rice, who knows. I also altered the recipe so i can't blame that. The flavor is spot on goodness!
This is a staple at meal time. An easy way to make brown rice palatable to everyone.

I used all of the ingredients, but substituted the diced tomatoes with Chipotle diced tomatoes. Along with Herdez Salsa Casera (HOT). 
Just in case you want an extra kick of flavor ;)
I used quick cooking brown rice and it was delicious! Will definitely be making this one again!

This was very tasty! I do not use fresh tomatoes in the winter so I just used an additional half cup of salsa to make up for it. A very simple recipe that helped add some variety to my brown rice. Thanks!
I did add cilantro to it.
I didn’t make any changes except for adding some more peppers and vegetables. The flavour was very good. Everyone really enjoyed it

I just increased my review to three stars because I found the recipe to be ok if you turned it into something else. As written, it tasted to me like rice and salsa, not Spanish rice. But add onion, pepper, corn, black beans, green onion, and lime juice (plus salt), and it’s a pretty decent main dish salad.
I like brown rice lot also healthy for you I just love tomatoes so this made it really good for me. husband is diabetic and brown rice is much better for him due to carbs.
Added some minced garlic but other than tha
Loved this!
Delicious! Great to have a recipe that uses brown rice. I used my rice maker and it came out great!

I do like this recipe but made a few small changes. I used brown rice because I did not have white. I sautéed 1/4 chopped onion and 1/4 chopped red pepper in coconut oil. Added the rice to brown a little before adding the liquid. Susbstituted some of the water with leftover Chicken Broth (1/4 cup) to use it up. I used medium salsa (1/2 cup), omitted the tomatoes because I used onion and red pepper, and at the recommendation of some, added garlic powder and chili powder - 2 shakes of each. I will make again and may add a little more of the seasoning because I love extra flavor. I would give 5 stars but I altered the recipe.
So yummy! And so easy. Added onion as suggested. Husband said better than restaurant Spanish rice. Will definitely make again.

Looking for a Spanish rice to go with the Spanish style chicken breast I was cooking. I would never thought putting salsa in with the rice. This was great. I also added onions like another reviewer said. I will make this again.
This came out a little sweeter then we like, but not bad overall.

This is really good! I used low-sodium chick broth instead of water, added ~2/3 cup finely chopped onion and 1 chipotle pepper (canned). Also increased the garlic to a tablespoon and added a small handful of Cilantro leaves for good measure and it was outstanding. Attractive presentation as well. Definitely use chunky salsa and diced tomatoes with chilies. The only tweak I'll make next time is to cook it one full hour since the rice keeps turning out a little firm for my tastes.

Very good side dish to go with grilled steaks and Black Bean and Cucumber Salad (from this site). I sautéed half an onion and a bit of green pepper in butter before adding garlic and rice. After a couple of minutes, added other ingredients and just let it go. During the long cooking time, I was able to prepare the rest of meal. I'll make this again!
Loved this recipe. I used my frozen salsa from my garden which is in 2 cup jars instead of adding the 1 cup tomatoes. I love the chewy texture of brown rice, so this is a new favorite!

I used chicken broth instead of water and still thought it was lacking in flavor. I think it needs more salsa and less other liquid. I also added black olives after it was done. Adding some bell peppers while it cooks might also help. Like that it was brown rice though!
this is very tasty will keep this recipe :)

I love this recipe. I use my rice cooker. Also anytime I have leftover broth from vegetables or chicken, I use that in place of the water. I also add chopped onions, and sometimes throw in some frozen peas and carrots.
I have to admit I was surprised at how much I liked this. Will make it again! Thx!
My family and I love this recipe! It's so fresh and tasty. We add onion like Arizona Desert Flower suggested.

We missed the cilantro from our normal recipe, but didn't miss the sodium content! I used thick and chunky salsa and added some extra onions (what Spanish rice doesn't have onions?). Used a fresh Roma tomato instead of the cup of diced tomatoes. My rice was done right at the 45 minute mark. The family said they would enjoy it more if it was white rice, but personally, I liked the brown. Next time I'll add some cilantro for personal family preference.
